message: Could whoever is doing the videos of the talks not cut out the questions?  This is really annoying.
I think at PyCon they had people with questions come up to a mike.  Having an intern run around would work too :)

Hi Aaron, I spoke with our videographer about this — and he said: "The main reason I cut out the questions is because you can't hear them. None of the speakers repeated the questions either, so what you get is a minute of silence...then, an explanation is given from an unexplained context."  Next year maybe we can have a mic in the audience.
Damn, and I thought about this problem at the time....  Perhaps we should have the interns run around the room with mics.
That's too bad.  This will be a really big problem with the tutorials.
I am really all for whichever is more entertaining...
Would it be possible to crowdsource the transcribing of the QA session? Maybe people who were there might be able to remember what question was asked based on the presenter's response.
We might have to wait for all of the videos to go up though...
@nmichaudagrawal We really should get these up on the Python miro community actually.  There is a fair community around transcribing there.  http://python.mirocommunity.org/
I also suspect that you can pick up the audio for at least some of them if you turn the volume way up.
